name: St. Peter Damian
summary: Peter Damian was an Italian Benedictine monk, cardinal, and reformer. He was a key figure in the Gregorian Reforms and worked to combat simony, clerical marriage, and other abuses in the Church. He was made Cardinal Bishop of Ostia and was a close advisor to several popes. He is venerated as a Doctor of the Church and is known for his asceticism and reform efforts.
